title: Meet the three candidates competing to lead France's conservative party Les Républicains
description: Members of Les Républicains are being called upon to choose the party's next president in December. Caught between Macronesque policies and the far right, Les Républicains must clarify its party line.

title: France boosts its military presence in Romania, deploys 750 soldiers
description: Armed Forces Minister Sébastien Lecornu officially opened the new facility, which is set to become France's main military base on Europe's eastern flank, on Thursday, November 3.

title: French government struggles to find middle ground on immigration debate
description: French President Emmanuel Macron insists on including measures to help with integration, while Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin is trying to gather votes from the right.

title: Iran might as well abolish journalism, says journalist organization
description: More than 50 journalists have been arrested since the start of the protests sparked by the death of Mahsa Amini.

title: French far-right MP suspended over 'back to Africa' outburst
description: Gregoire de Fournas, a newly-elected member of the Rassemblement National will receive a 15-day suspension after his racist remark.

title: Imran Khan says Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif involved in plot to kill him
description: In his first public appearance since he was shot, Imran Khan accused Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif of being involved in his assassination attempt.

title: Trump eyes 2024 run as Democrats brace for punishing midterms
description: The former US president dropped a hint at a possible 2024 return to the White House on Friday, as President Joe Biden heads out across the country to get out the vote for the midterms.

title: Fired by e-mail: Elon Musk launches a wave of layoffs at Twitter
description: An e-mail sent Thursday to the social media company's 7,000 employees confirms rumors of forced departures that have been circulating since the Tesla boss bought the social media platform.

title: Israel's Benyamin Netanyahu wins majority, final count confirms
description: The Likud leader won 64 of the 120 seats in Israel's Knesset with his far-right allies, marking a return to the right for the country.

title: Sixteen Nobel Prize winners: 'We urge the world not to forget Alaa Abd el-Fattah and the thousands of political prisoners in Egypt's prisons'
description: Sixteen Nobel Prize winners, including Annie Ernaux, Wole Soyinka, Svetlana Alexievich, Mario Vargas Llosa, and J.M. Coetzee urge heads of state and government attending COP27 in Sharm El-Sheikh to demand the release of political prisoners, including the writer and philosopher who has been on hunger strike for six months.

title: Italy's Meloni appeals to Brussels while drawing criticism back home
description: The far-right prime minister welcomed a 'very frank and positive exchange' with leaders of the European Council, Commission and Parliament. Back in Italy, a sudden law limiting gatherings is causing concern.

title: Finnish PM Marin cleared of misconduct in partying scandal
description: Complaints were filed against Prime Minister Sanna Marin after a video leaked of her partying in August.

title: A racist remark in the Assemblée Nationale undermines the far right's search for respectability
description: The French Assemblée's parliamentary leadership committee is meeting today to decide on a potential punishment for far-right MP Grégoire de Fournas.

title: Germany to introduce €49 nationwide transport pass
description: The €49 ($48.50) transport ticket follows the successful €9 summer ticket the country implemented from June to August.

title: Imran Khan: Pakistan plunges into uncertainty following assassination attempt on former PM
description: After being ousted in April, the former prime minister has been campaigning across the country, calling for early elections.

title: Hundreds of elephants, zebras die as Kenya weathers drought
description: More than 200 elephants and almost 400 common zebras have died from the severe drought across East Africa.

title: Israel's disturbing new face
description: After the parliamentary elections, which saw the far-right faction make a historic breakthrough in parliament, a new face of the Jewish state is taking shape.

title: British home secretary under fire over saturated asylum system
description: Reappointed by new British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak after her resignation in October, Suella Braverman is once again facing criticism as the situation for migrants worsens.

title: US midterms: The age of denialism
description: 'The US midterm elections as seen from my French window': Denialism has become a fundamental part of the modus operandi for Republicans, writes former US correspondent Gilles Paris.

title: How Ben-Gvir became the evil genius of Israel's conservatives
description: As the head of the third largest political force in Israel after the legislative elections, the politician promises to deliver to Benjamin Netanyahu's right-wing bloc the majority it was missing.

title: Ethiopia and the Tigrayan People's Liberation Front sign a fragile peace accord
description: The warring parties signed a ceasefire in Pretoria after two years of fratricidal civil war.

title: France's EDF cuts estimated electricity output again on nuclear woes
description: EDF said there were further delays in maintenance and security checks on offline reactors.

title: Ukraine uses naval suicide drones for the first time against Russian fleet in Crimea
description: The Ukrainian attack on the port of the Russian military fleet in the Black Sea, using small unmanned surface ships, is part of a broader movement towards drone-based naval combat that is being considered by many of the world's armies.

title: In Bahrain, Pope Francis advocates for the rights of immigrant workers
description: Pope Francis, who came to promote dialogue between Muslims and Christians, began his three-day visit by addressing human rights and the death penalty.

title: UK government rules out Northern Ireland elections before 2023, says minister
description: The deadline for forming a power-sharing government passed last week, after elections last May.

title: Life imprisonment in France for Liberian warlord after landmark trial
description: The 47-year-old former rebel leader Kunti Kamara appeared before Paris's criminal court under 'universal jurisdiction' accused of 'acts of barbarism and complicity in crimes against humanity' during the first civil war in Liberia.

title: South Korea scrambles jets after detecting 180 North Korean warplanes
description: The North Korean aircraft flew north of the military border, South Korea's military said in a statement.

title: US midterm elections: Republicans step up their attacks on absentee voting
description: In the wake of Donald Trump's accusations, Republican candidates have cast doubts on a voting method that has become widespread across the country. For Democrats, these accusations constitute a threat to democracy.

title: COP27's problematic sponsor: Coca-Cola
description: Advocacy groups have criticized the partnership between the annual climate conference and the world's foremost plastic polluter.

title: NBA: The Brooklyn Nets suspend Kyrie Irving for refusing to disavow anti-semitism
description: The Nets said they were "dismayed" by the NBA star's response after he was criticized for posting a link to anti-semitic material.

title: Twitter will lay off employees starting Friday
description: A company-wide email says Twitter employees will receive word at the start of business Friday. The 'Washington Post' and 'New York Times' reported that about half of Twitter's 7,500 employees will be let go.

title: 'Elon Musk is setting himself a complicated challenge with Twitter.'
description: 'Le Monde' columnist Alexandre Piquard underlines the extent to which the richest man in the world is setting a high bar by wanting to transform Twitter into a profitable, prosperous and free company.
